channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: The Impact of Differential Privacy on Recommendation Accuracy and Popularity Bias
item.description: In this work, we study how DP impacts recommendation accuracy and popularity bias, when applied to the training data of state-of-the-art recommendation models.

item.title: Improved motif-scaffolding with SE(3) flow matching
item.description: The first is motif amortization, in which FrameFlow is trained with the motif as input using a data augmentation strategy.

item.title: A Large-scale Empirical Study on Improving the Fairness of Deep Learning Models
item.description: Specifically, we target the widely-used application scenario of image classification, and utilized three different datasets and five commonly-used performance metrics to assess in total 13 methods from diverse categories.

item.title: Using reinforcement learning to improve drone-based inference of greenhouse gas fluxes
item.description: Accurate mapping of greenhouse gas fluxes at the Earth's surface is essential for the validation and calibration of climate models.

item.title: Anatomy of Neural Language Models
item.description: Generative AI and transfer learning fields have experienced remarkable advancements in recent years especially in the domain of Natural Language Processing (NLP).

item.title: scDiffusion: conditional generation of high-quality single-cell data using diffusion model
item.description: Experiments showed that scDiffusion can generate single-cell gene expression data closely resembling real scRNA-seq data, surpassing state-of-the-art models in multiple metrics.

item.title: SpeechAgents: Human-Communication Simulation with Multi-Modal Multi-Agent Systems
item.description: In this paper, we propose SpeechAgents, a multi-modal LLM based multi-agent system designed for simulating human communication.

item.title: Reproducibility Analysis and Enhancements for Multi-Aspect Dense Retriever with Aspect Learning
item.description: MADRAL was evaluated on proprietary data and its code was not released, making it challenging to validate its effectiveness on other datasets.

item.title: TextMachina: Seamless Generation of Machine-Generated Text Datasets
item.description: Recent advancements in Large Language Models (LLMs) have led to high-quality Machine-Generated Text (MGT), giving rise to countless new use cases and applications.

item.title: A Content-Based Novelty Measure for Scholarly Publications: A Proof of Concept
item.description: Novelty, akin to gene mutation in evolution, opens possibilities for scientific advancement.

item.title: Uncertainty Quantification on Clinical Trial Outcome Prediction
item.description: Selective classification, encompassing a spectrum of methods for uncertainty quantification, empowers the model to withhold decision-making in the face of samples marked by ambiguity or low confidence, thereby amplifying the accuracy of predictions for the instances it chooses to classify.

item.title: Building Efficient and Effective OpenQA Systems for Low-Resource Languages
item.description: We present SQuAD-TR, a machine translation of SQuAD2. 0, and we build our OpenQA system by adapting ColBERT-QA for Turkish.

item.title: Effective Benchmarks for Optical Turbulence Modeling
item.description: Effective modeling of optical turbulence strength is critical for the development and deployment of these systems.

item.title: See360: Novel Panoramic View Interpolation
item.description: We present See360, which is a versatile and efficient framework for 360 panoramic view interpolation using latent space viewpoint estimation.

item.title: DiarizationLM: Speaker Diarization Post-Processing with Large Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce DiarizationLM, a framework to leverage large language models (LLM) to post-process the outputs from a speaker diarization system.

item.title: CAPTAIN at COLIEE 2023: Efficient Methods for Legal Information Retrieval and Entailment Tasks
item.description: The Competition on Legal Information Extraction/Entailment (COLIEE) is held annually to encourage advancements in the automatic processing of legal texts.

item.title: Improving Transferability of Network Intrusion Detection in a Federated Learning Setup
item.description: Network Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) aim to detect the presence of an intruder by analyzing network packets arriving at an internet connected device.

item.title: Multi-Modal Representation Learning for Molecular Property Prediction: Sequence, Graph, Geometry
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel data augmentation technique that modifies the topology of the molecular graph to generate augmented data with the same molecular connectivity index as the original data.

item.title: Global Prediction of COVID-19 Variant Emergence Using Dynamics-Informed Graph Neural Networks
item.description: The current methods for predicting the spread of new variants rely on statistical modeling, however, these methods work only when the new variant has already arrived in the region of interest and has a significant prevalence.

item.title: FedTGP: Trainable Global Prototypes with Adaptive-Margin-Enhanced Contrastive Learning for Data and Model Heterogeneity in Federated Learning
item.description: To reduce the high communication cost of transmitting model parameters, a major challenge in HtFL, prototype-based HtFL methods are proposed to solely share class representatives, a. k. a, prototypes, among heterogeneous clients while maintaining the privacy of clients' models.

item.title: Fair Sampling in Diffusion Models through Switching Mechanism
item.description: Diffusion models have shown their effectiveness in generation tasks by well-approximating the underlying probability distribution.

item.title: The Dawn After the Dark: An Empirical Study on Factuality Hallucination in Large Language Models
item.description: To tackle the LLM hallucination, three key questions should be well studied: how to detect hallucinations (detection), why do LLMs hallucinate (source), and what can be done to mitigate them (mitigation).

item.title: Picky Eaters Make For Better Raters
item.description: It has been established in the literature that the number of ratings and the scores restaurants obtain on online rating systems (ORS) significantly impact their revenue.

item.title: MLLM-Protector: Ensuring MLLM's Safety without Hurting Performance
item.description: The deployment of multimodal large language models (MLLMs) has brought forth a unique vulnerability: susceptibility to malicious attacks through visual inputs.

item.title: Identification of 4FGL uncertain sources at Higher Resolutions with Inverse Discrete Wavelet Transform
item.description: In the forthcoming era of big astronomical data, it is a burden to find out target sources from ground-based and space-based telescopes.

item.title: Reading Between the Frames: Multi-Modal Depression Detection in Videos from Non-Verbal Cues
item.description: Depression, a prominent contributor to global disability, affects a substantial portion of the population.

item.title: Learning Image Demoireing from Unpaired Real Data
item.description: The proposed method, referred to as Unpaired Demoireing (UnDeM), synthesizes pseudo moire images from unpaired datasets, generating pairs with clean images for training demoireing models.

item.title: CrisisViT: A Robust Vision Transformer for Crisis Image Classification
item.description: We leverage the new Incidents1M crisis image dataset to develop a range of new transformer-based image classification models.

item.title: Let's Get It Started: Fostering the Discoverability of New Releases on Deezer
item.description: This paper presents our recent initiatives to foster the discoverability of new releases on the music streaming service Deezer.

item.title: Verifying Relational Explanations: A Probabilistic Approach
item.description: Explanations on relational data are hard to verify since the explanation structures are more complex (e. g. graphs).

item.title: Open-Vocabulary SAM: Segment and Recognize Twenty-thousand Classes Interactively
item.description: The CLIP and Segment Anything Model (SAM) are remarkable vision foundation models (VFMs).

item.title: DiffBody: Diffusion-based Pose and Shape Editing of Human Images
item.description: Because this initial textured body model has artifacts due to occlusion and the inaccurate body shape, the rendered image undergoes a diffusion-based refinement, in which strong noise destroys body structure and identity whereas insufficient noise does not help.

item.title: AST-T5: Structure-Aware Pretraining for Code Generation and Understanding
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have made significant advancements in code-related tasks, yet many LLMs treat code as simple sequences, neglecting its structured nature.

item.title: PeFoMed: Parameter Efficient Fine-tuning on Multimodal Large Language Models for Medical Visual Question Answering
item.description: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) represent an evolutionary expansion in the capabilities of traditional large language models, enabling them to tackle challenges that surpass the scope of purely text-based applications.

item.title: FED-NeRF: Achieve High 3D Consistency and Temporal Coherence for Face Video Editing on Dynamic NeRF
item.description: However, achieving simultaneously multi-view consistency and temporal coherence while editing video sequences remains a formidable challenge.

item.title: Dagma-DCE: Interpretable, Non-Parametric Differentiable Causal Discovery
item.description: We introduce Dagma-DCE, an interpretable and model-agnostic scheme for differentiable causal discovery.

item.title: Locally Adaptive Neural 3D Morphable Models
item.description: We present the Locally Adaptive Morphable Model (LAMM), a highly flexible Auto-Encoder (AE) framework for learning to generate and manipulate 3D meshes.

item.title: AG-ReID.v2: Bridging Aerial and Ground Views for Person Re-identification
item.description: To address this, we introduce AG-ReID. v2, a dataset specifically designed for person Re-ID in mixed aerial and ground scenarios.

item.title: On the numerical reliability of nonsmooth autodiff: a MaxPool case study
item.description: Using SGD for the training process, we study the impact of different choices of the nonsmooth Jacobian for the MaxPool function on the precision of 16 and 32 bits.

item.title: FedNS: A Fast Sketching Newton-Type Algorithm for Federated Learning
item.description: We provide convergence analysis based on statistical learning for the federated Newton sketch approaches.

item.title: German Text Embedding Clustering Benchmark
item.description: This work introduces a benchmark assessing the performance of clustering German text embeddings in different domains.

item.title: DHGCN: Dynamic Hop Graph Convolution Network for Self-supervised Point Cloud Learning
item.description: Recent works attempt to extend Graph Convolution Networks (GCNs) to point clouds for classification and segmentation tasks.

item.title: Credence: Augmenting Datacenter Switch Buffer Sharing with ML Predictions
item.description: This suggests that augmenting drop-tail algorithms with predictions about the future arrivals has the potential to significantly improve performance.

item.title: Enhancing targeted transferability via feature space fine-tuning
item.description: Adversarial examples (AEs) have been extensively studied due to their potential for privacy protection and inspiring robust neural networks.

item.title: Unsupervised hard Negative Augmentation for contrastive learning
item.description: We present Unsupervised hard Negative Augmentation (UNA), a method that generates synthetic negative instances based on the term frequency-inverse document frequency (TF-IDF) retrieval model.

item.title: Enhancing 3D-Air Signature by Pen Tip Tail Trajectory Awareness: Dataset and Featuring by Novel Spatio-temporal CNN
item.description: We proposed SliT-CNN, a novel 2D spatial-temporal convolutional neural network (CNN) for better featuring of the air signature.

item.title: Characteristics and prevalence of fake social media profiles with AI-generated faces
item.description: Applying this method to a random sample of active Twitter users, we estimate a lower bound for the prevalence of profiles using GAN-generated faces between 0. 021% and 0. 044% -- around 10K daily active accounts.

item.title: UnetTSF: A Better Performance Linear Complexity Time Series Prediction Model
item.description: Out of 32 testing projects, 31 achieved the best results.

item.title: Latte: Latent Diffusion Transformer for Video Generation
item.description: We propose a novel Latent Diffusion Transformer, namely Latte, for video generation.

item.title: Scaling and Masking: A New Paradigm of Data Sampling for Image and Video Quality Assessment
item.description: In this work, instead of stacking up models, a more elegant data sampling method (named as SAMA, scaling and masking) is explored, which compacts both the local and global content in a regular input size.
